headline: Why The Narrative Around Bright Horizons Family Solutions Is Shifting With Back Up Care Focus
summary: Bright Horizons Family Solutions has seen its fair value estimate edge down slightly to about $128.78 per share, as analysts adopt a touch more caution on the pace of its long term revenue growth. At the same time, a marginally higher discount rate of roughly 7.66% reflects a more balanced view of macro and execution risks, even as optimism around the underappreciated back up care opportunity remains intact. Stay tuned to learn how you can track these subtle shifts in assumptions and stay...

headline: Why Analysts See Federated Hermes Story Improving After Q3 Beat And Modest Target Raises
summary: Federated Hermes' fair value estimate has nudged up to about $53.29 from roughly $52.43 as analysts factor in stronger expected revenue growth of around 5.06% versus about 3.94% previously, reflecting greater confidence in the company’s ability to build on its Q3 execution. A slightly lower discount rate of approximately 8.36% from about 8.43% further supports a higher present value for future cash flows, even as research houses remain measured in their overall stance. Stay tuned to learn how...

A slightly lower discount rate of approximately 8.36% from about 8.43% further supports a higher present value for future cash flows, even as research houses remain measured in their overall stance. headline: 3 Bank Stocks We Keep Off Our Radar
summary: Banks play a critical role in the financial system, providing everything from commercial loans to wealth management and payment processing services. Furthermore, economic conditions have supported loan growth and fee income, a trend that has enabled the banking industry to return 13.9% over the past six months, almost identical to the S&P 500.

headline: JPMorgan Is Exploring Crypto Trading for Institutional Clients
summary: The Wall Street giant is assessing what products and services its markets division could offer to expand its footprint in cryptocurrencies, according to a person familiar with the plans.  This could include spot and derivatives trading, said the person who asked not to be identified as the plans are not public.  The efforts, which are in their early stages, are in response to rising interest from clients following changes in the US regulatory environment around digital assets, the person added.

content.title: JPMorgan Is Exploring Crypto Trading for Institutional Clients
content.summary: The Wall Street giant is assessing what products and services its markets division could offer to expand its footprint in cryptocurrencies, according to a person familiar with the plans.  This could include spot and derivatives trading, said the person who asked not to be identified as the plans are not public.  The efforts, which are in their early stages, are in response to rising interest from clients following changes in the US regulatory environment around digital assets, the person added.

headline: Bond Markets Clear Path for Stock Rally by Ignoring a Near-Term Risk
summary: Bond markets are doing their part to deliver a Santa Claus rally for stocks as investors up the ante on more Federal Reserve rate cuts in the new year and brush off inflation worries in the world’s biggest economy.  A softer-than-expected inflation reading for the month of November, published last week, along with the expected new leadership at the Fed pushing for deeper rate cuts, have driven short-term Treasury bond yields sharply lower over the past two weeks.  Further pressure has been building on shorter-term Treasury bill yields as the Fed begins its months-long effort to ease liquidity concerns in the banking sector through a program of regular monthly purchases expected to last until late spring.

content.title: Bond Markets Clear Path for Stock Rally by Ignoring a Near-Term Risk
content.summary: Bond markets are doing their part to deliver a Santa Claus rally for stocks as investors up the ante on more Federal Reserve rate cuts in the new year and brush off inflation worries in the world’s biggest economy. Further pressure has been building on shorter-term Treasury bill yields as the Fed begins its months-long effort to ease liquidity concerns in the banking sector through a program of regular monthly purchases expected to last until late spring.

headline: 2026 outlook: Big Banks are getting back their 'earnings mojo'
summary: Major bank stocks are poised to close 2025 with serious gains; most notably, Citigroup shares (C) are already up 67% while Goldman Sachs (GS) has surged 57% (or nearly $330) year-to-date. Whalen Global Advisors founder and chairman Chris Whalen — alongside TPW Advisory founder Jay Pelosky — speaks with Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman about his consensus on the banking sector heading into 2026, citing various corporate credit risks amid the Federal Reserve's current interest rate environment. Also catch Yahoo Finance Senior Banking Reporter David Hollerith and Hennion & Walsh CIO Kevin Mahn discuss the 2026 outlook for regional banks. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

content.title: 2026 outlook: Big Banks are getting back their 'earnings mojo'
content.description:
Major bank stocks are poised to close 2025 with serious gains; most notably, Citigroup shares (C) are already up 67% while Goldman Sachs (GS) has surged 57% (or nearly $330) year-to-date.

Whalen Global Advisors founder and chairman Chris Whalen — alongside TPW Advisory founder Jay Pelosky — speaks with Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman about his consensus on the banking sector heading into 2026, citing various corporate credit risks amid the Federal Reserve's current interest rate environment.

Also catch Yahoo Finance Senior Banking Reporter David Hollerith and Hennion & Walsh CIO Kevin Mahn discuss the 2026 outlook for regional banks.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.
